column1: ADHIR RANJAN CHOWDHURY | ADHIRA RAMJANA CHAUDHARI | PI PI CHAUDHARI
column2: Hon. Speaker Sir, I rise to dwell on the PresidentтАЩs Address. As we know, in our Parliamentary democracy, PresidentтАЩs Address is always recognised as a solemn occasion. The genesis of this exercise goes back to 1921. In the aftermath of Independence, the provisional Parliament, in the year 1950, lasted for two years, two months and 22 days. The number of Members were 313 and discussion was held for three days following the PresidentтАЩs Address. We know that PresidentтАЩs Address is regarded as a statement of policy whereby it contains the activities and achievements of the Government for the previous year. It also incorporates both internal and international policies of the Government. Everything is right but I fail to subscribe to the views enshrined in this PresidentтАЩs Address. And that, I will try to elucidate in my following speech. Sir, yesterday, Dr. Satya Pal Singhjiwas referring to Swami Vivekananda. His name was Narendranath Datta. He was trying to juxtapose the then Swami Vivekanandaji, who was a Saint and a Demigod, in our view, with the present Prime Minister of our country, Shri Narendra Modiji.Anybody can compare one with anybody else; there is no issue of it. But there is a yawning gap between Shri Narendranath Datta and Shri Narendra Modi. If one is regarded asтАШYogiтАЩ, another is regarded asтАж (Not recorded)тАж(Interruptions) рдбреЙ. рдирд┐рд╢рд┐рдХрд╛рдВрдд рджреБрдмреЗ (рдЧреЛрдбреНрдбрд╛): рдорд╣реЛрджрдп , рдпрд╣ рдЕрдирдкрд╛рд░реНрд▓рд┐рдпрд╛рдореЗрдиреНрдЯрд░реА рд╢рдмреНрдж рд╣реИ редтАж(рд╡реНрдпрд╡рдзрд╛рди) <u> рд╕рд░ , рдЕрдЧрд░ рдЖрдкрдХреЛ рдпрд╣ рд▓рдЧреЗ рдХрд┐ рдореИрдВрдиреЗ рдХреЛрдИ рдЕрдирдкрд╛рд░реНрд▓рд┐рдпрд╛рдореЗрдиреНрдЯрд░реА рд╡рд░реНрдб рдЗрд╕реНрддреЗрдорд╛рд▓ рдХрд┐рдпрд╛ рд╣реИ , рддреЛ рдЖрдк рдЬреЛ рдЪрд╛рд╣реЗ рд╡рд╣ рдХрд░ рд╕рдХрддреЗ рд╣реИрдВ , рд▓реЗрдХрд┐рди рдореЗрд░реЗ рдмреЛрд▓рдиреЗ рдХрд╛ рдордХрд╕рдж рдпрд╣ рд╣реИ рдХрд┐ we are living in a material word. column367: I am rising to speak to oppose the Motion of Thanks on the PresidentтАЩs Address. But who will I speak to? These empty Treasury Benches! There is only one Minister from Rajya Sabha and only one Lady Minister from the Lok Sabha. All the others are тАШhalf MinistersтАЩ. тАж(Interruptions) Shri Arjun Munda is also here. So
column368: all тАШreserved peopleтАЩ are here but the Ministers have all fled. They have gone for the Delhi elections which they are going to lose. Remember this. тАж(Interruptions) Sir
column369: I speak in favour of the eight amendments moved by me. Most of them relate to the nationwide agitation against the Citizenship Amendment Act and the insecurity among the minority community over the Act. The amendments specifically relate to protest
column370: especially by students and women as in Shaheen Bagh. They also refer to the lowest GDP growth of 4.8 per cent and the highest unemployment rate in 45 years. тАж(Interruptions)"

R.K. RANJAN (INNER MANIPUR) : Presidential Address is a statement of National Policy. The address contains a review of various activities and achievements of the Government during the year 2019. Over and above the PresidentтАЩs Address focuses sharply on the vision of New India based on the solemnMantra SUBKA SAATH SUBKA VIKAS AND SUBKA VISHWAS. And this is the soul aspiration of millions of Indians. The Address was empowering every Indian to make ourself self-reliant, strong and vibrant New India. Now, being a north-easterner, I feel secure and stable to experience constant development in the region and particularly in infrastructural section. Many decades ago before our party came into power, the region was left unattainedLANDLOCKRegion. However, our HonтАЩble Prime Minister Shri Narendra Modi jiтАЩs special attention in the Region, theLANDLOCKRegion has been transformed intoLANDLINKEDspecially underACT EAST POLICY. The Region has been providing immense scope for development participation with thefocal Hub of Asian countries. We also enjoy more comfort and feeling of emotional attachment with the enhancement in physical connectivity. We are happy for the tireless effort of the present Government for extending Rail connectivity to the capitals of Sikkim, Mizoram, Manipur and Nagaland by 2022. Here I would like to request the Rail Ministry to respect the word of the HonтАЩble President. Last but not the least, we were happy for the allocation of Rs. 9,000 crore to lay the foundation ofGas Based Economyin all the 8 states of North East India. Lastly, North East India is the heaviest rainfall region of the world but the region is suffering from acute shortage of potable water; however, with the launching ofJal Jeevan Missionwe will be able to join the movement effectively. With this bright vision and scope for development I strongly support the motion of thanks. * * SHRI BHARTRUHARI MAHTAB (CUTTACK) : HonтАЩble President while addressing the Joint Session of Parliament the other day, has outlined the major policy achievement and objectives of the government. Government intends to make India a five trillion-dollar economy. Foreign exchange reserves are over USD 450 billion. Flow of Foreign Direct Investment has increased by three billion USD within April to October last. IndiaтАЩs ranking in the ease of Daily Business Index has improved from 142 in 2014 to 63 in 2020. Soon after Independence, the ruling Congress had made a radical departure from traditional economic arrangements by adopting a socialist, statist agenda. Opposition to it came from the Conservative Swatantra Party, which defended economic freedom against Congress Licence Raj. Although in 1991 Congress jettisoned socialism, it has remained a reluctant reformer. Liberals within the Congress have invariably prevailed over conservatives. On the other hand, the present day ruling dispensation lay a stronger claim to conservatism, based on religious nationalism. Republicans in America, Tories in England and Christian Democrats in Germany also provide a home for religious and nationalist conservatives. In this juncture one should think about our Liberals. Wounds of Partition have been reopened by the change in KashmirтАЩs status. Liberals, from Nehru onwards, have tried but failed to bring about a non-resentful assimilation of Kashmiris into India. Might a conservative today, someone like Rajagopalachari would succeed? We do not hear voices of moderate Hinduism or Muslims in contemporary Indian public life. They are drowned by the shrill sounds of Hindu nationalists and left secularists. Both have failed us. Once upon a time public figures like Gandhi, Maulana Azad and Swami Vivekananda spoke with credibility to the silent majority of religious minded Indians. CanтАЩt we ask a question to ourselves today that why do we need Hindu nationalism in a nation where 80% are Hindus? The problem with Left secularists is that they were once socialists and only see the dark side of religion intolerance, murderous wars and nationalism; they forget that religion has given meaning to humanity since the dawn of civilization. Because secularists and Hindu Nationalists speak a language alien to the common man. They are only able to condemn communal violence but cannot stop it as Gandhi did in Bengal in 1947. It is really gratifying to note that there is a rise of a contemporary conservative ideals. Lot of talk is now being done on Citizenship Amendment Act тАУ 2019. LetтАЩs fall back, a little bit on history. Refugees were pouring in after the partition. In 1950, the immigrants (expulsion from Assam) Act provided for the expulsion of certain immigrants who had come to Assam and lived in different parts of India. The then Central Government viewed their stay as being detrimental to the interest of the general public of India. The Act replaced the Ordinance on January 7, 1950 and was passed in Parliament a month later. There was demand to mention religious community in the Bill. That was not accepted. Rather тАЬany persons who on account of civil disturbances or the fear of such disturbances in Pakistan has been displaced from or left his place of residence in any such area and who has been subsequently residing in Assam.тАЭ This Act explicitly mentioned that any person, who has fled Pakistan on account of civil disturbances or the fear of one, would be provided citizenship. Today allhellbeen let loose because religions been mentioned. This could have been avoided. Thirty years have passed by and Kashmiri Pandits are living an exiled life from their native place. The suffering, the loss, the neglect, the injustice, the hypocrisy of advocates of human rights have been said again and again. Yet, the pain refuses to subside, home remains out of bounds. The wound of resentment continue to fester. With abrogation of Article 370 and 35A, one has to nurture a conducive atmosphere to facilitate not only the return, but the re-assimilation of the displaced community that formed an inextricable part of Kashmir ethos. Reconciliation needs acceptance that wrongs of enormous proportions were committed. Then only a beginning can be made. hell Similarly, much talk is about National Population Register. The NPR, is a register of the countryтАЩs тАЬusual residentsтАЭ тАУ those who have stayed at a place for six months or intend to stay there for the next six months тАУ is scheduled to be updated simultaneously with the house тАУ listing process of the decennial Census. This humongous task will involve lakhs of officials and tons of paperwork. The GovernmentтАЩs effort to delink it from the National Register of Citizens (NRC) have largely proved futile. With Assam NRC fiasco fresh in memory, the ruling dispensation should remove doubts regarding the exercise. But there is a need to have caste census alongside. The last Caste Census was done in 1931. Odisha has a large concentration of Scheduled Tribes who form about 23% and the Scheduled Castes are around 16% leaving very little scope to provide reservation fully to OBCs. Once the Caste Census is done, Odisha can claim to breach the 50% mark and help the weaker section of the society. I would like to draw the attention of the Government regarding Global Hunger Index which has ranked India a lowly 102 among the 117 countries it has mapped. India was 103 last year. Though the rank is one better, in reality India is not better off in comparison to the other countries. Among the BRICS grouping, India is ranked the worst. Within South Asia too, India is behind every other country. Srilanka, Nepal, Bangladesh and Pakistan are all ahead of India. Saudi Arabia, Venenzuela are way ahead. In contrast to India, which has the WorldтАЩs largest democracy and one of the biggest economies has fallen behind in World Hunger Index. Notwithstanding the broader improvements, there is one category тАУ Child wasting, that is, children with low weight for their age тАУ India has worsened. This needs to be given utmost attention. Along with тАЬClean IndiaтАЭ programme, populationтАЩs health and childrenтАЩs growth and development should be attended to. One of the major problems facing the world and India was an exponential growth in population. But, that problem might be reversed in recent years. Many parts of India are already ageing. We had been talking of population divided for last twenty years. We take pride that India is a young nation with maximum number of young people. But that is going to change soon тАУ In another 15 years, the aged people population will be more than the young. Are we prepared for it? With fewer students and large number of older people to support, the level of human capital imparted to each member of the workforce becomes vital. But 2031, the size of the working age population will start to decline in 11 States. In other words, India should be preparing for a situation in which large parts of the country will suffer the тАЬrich economyтАЭ problem of stagnant or declining populations. If we do not make effective use of the strengths of our youth now, we may never be able to do so. The great challenge is creating decent jobs for its growing young population of today. Action is required in multiple fronts including investment in human capital, revival of the productive sectors and programmes to stimulate small entrepreneurship. If we are unable to make effective use of the strength of young, we can perhaps never do so as in another two decades, IndiaтАЩs population will start getting older. As in the past, OxfamтАЩs latest data тАУ released at the World Economic Forum, where the worldтАЩs rich and powerful meet тАУ is shocking. It says the top 1% of Indians own 42.5% of the countryтАЩs wealth while the bottom 50% own mere 2.8%. Oxfam says that taking an additional 0.5% of the wealth of the richest 1% over the next years will give enough investment to create 117 million jobs in education, health and elderly care etc. This data seems dodgy. Even if it is correct, the real issue is the policy prescription. Blaming the rich for not being able to spend enough on education is just deflecting the real issues. If India is to reduce inequalities, people need to get better jobs, whether in manufacturing or services. Yet, while textiles and readymade garments have catapulted countries like China and Vietnam of poverty, air policies have kept it from benefiting as much from the global bloom in textiles. Rather than getting caught up in the rich-poor debate, it makes more sense to focus on policies that free up the economy and create millions of job across various sectors. IndiaтАЩs liberalization policies since 1991, were about no demonizing the rich, and allowing them to set up new businesses. HonтАЩble President has referred to the geographical spread of Naxalism steadily shrinking. It is for states like Odisha which has enabled such a success that Naxalism has lost ground. The Bichinanchal in Malkangiri has become today the Swabhiman тАУ anchal and there is targeted development in that region which were earlier infested by Left Wing Extremism. Lot many things are being said about doubling of FarmersтАЩ income. A simple calculation can be made. The expenditure incurred to get a quintal of paddy is Rs. 2403/-. As per the Commission For Agricultural Custom and Price, a farmer spend around Rs. 1703/- for a quintal of paddy. What is the MSP for paddy today? Rs. 2340/-, Right. Then how much does the farmer get? And that too after toiling for months together. How can farming be made profitable, that is the moot question. Odisha has demanded to increase the paddy MSP to Rs. 2930 per quintal. In para 59 of HonтАЩble PresidentтАЩs speech, it is mentioned that on 1stAugust this year the hundredth Death Anniversary of Bal Gangadhar Tilak will be observed. Other than stating Freedom is my Birth Right, Tilak has also stated Criticism is not Sedition. This year the country should strive to do away with Section 124A. Sedition Law was enacted in 17thCentuty England, when lawmakers believed that only good opinions of the government should survive as bad opinions were detrimental to the government and monarchy. This sentiment and law was borrowed and inserted into the IPC in 1870. This law must go as it has happened in the United Kingdom already. Abolition of Sedition Law this year would be a fitting tribute in memory of Tilak. Before concluding, I must say in todayтАЩs World, Federalism is weakening day by day in our country. Concentration of power by the Union government is increasing rapidly. Even the powers of Speakers of Legislative Assemblies are getting curbed by directions of the Court. Curbing the powers of the Speaker of State Assemblies and entrusting these to a Central Authority is dangerous to the Federal system. IsnтАЩt India a Union of States? The draft National Education Policy 2019 seeks to create a new system, a revision and revamping of all aspects of the education structure, regulation and governance. A single overarching micro managed education policy for a country of immense demographic, social cultural, linguistic, developmental and historical diversity is not at all advisable. At this rate of usurping StateтАЩs powers by the Centre, the time is not far off when the States will be reduced to glorified municipalities. Yet I would say, HonтАЩble PresidentтАЩs speech has earmarked the issues that confront our nation today. Some decisions have been taken by the government and some are yet to be taken. As in the formative years of this young independent India, while drafting the Constitution there was intense debate on contentious issues. On some decisions were taken and some were left for the posterity, single language for governance, and Indian reverence for the cow, were put aside as part of an agenda for the future. Yet with a desire to spell out as much detail, as p

column1: ssible and take into account as much of the diversity of India as possible
column2: the Constitution could encompass many and the template provided has continued to transform India. The present government is taking some decisions which were not taken earlier. Some are not happy with it. Some are apprehensive. Some are angry. But one thing we must appreciate and that is our Constitution has created a people who are not scared of their government any more. ╪│┘Ж╪и┌╛┘Д ) : ┘Е╪н╪к╪▒┘Е ╪з╪│┘╛█М┌й╪▒ ╪╡╪з╪н╪и╪М ┘Е█М┌║ ╪з┘У┘╛ ┌й╪з ╪┤┌й╪▒ ┌п╪▓╪з╪▒ █Б┘И┌║ ┌й█Б ╪з┘У┘╛ ┘Ж█Т ╪│╪и ╪│█Т ╪з┘У╪о╪▒ ┘Е█М┌║ ┘И┘В╪к ╪п█М╪з █Б█Т█Ф ┘Е█М┌║ ╪к█М┘Ж ╪п┘Ж ╪│█Т ╪з┘Ж╪к╪╕╪з╪▒ ┌й╪▒ ╪▒█Б╪з ╪к┌╛╪з█Ф █М█Б █Б┘Ж╪п┘И╪│╪к╪з┘Ж ╪│╪и ┌й╪з █Б█Т█Ф ╪│╪и █Б┘Ж╪п┘И╪│╪к╪з┘Ж ┌й█Т ╪▒█Б┘Ж█Т ┘И╪з┘Д█Т █Б█М┌║ ┌Ж╪з█Б█Т ┘И█Б ┌й╪│█М ╪и┌╛█М ┘Е╪░█Б╪и ╪│█Т █Б┘И┌║╪М ╪и┘Р╪▒╪з╪п╪▒█М ┌й█Т █Б┘И┌║╪М ╪│╪и ┌й┘И █М█Б█М┌║ ╪▒█Б┘Ж╪з █Б█Т ╪з┘И╪▒ █Б┘Е█М┌║ ╪з╪│ ╪и╪з╪к ┘╛╪▒ ┘Б╪о╪▒ █Б█Т ┌й█Б █Б┘Е █Б┘Ж╪п┘И╪│╪к╪з┘Ж█М █Б█М┌║█Ф ┘Д█Б┘░╪░╪з █Б┘Е █Б┘Ж╪п┘И╪│╪к╪з┘Ж ┘Е█М┌║ ╪▒█Б ┌й╪▒ ╪и╪н█М╪л█М╪к ┘Е╪│┘Д┘Е╪з┘Ж ┌й█М ╪▓┘Ж╪п┌п█М ┌п╪▓╪з╪▒╪к█Т █Б█М┌║█Ф ╪│╪▒┌й╪з╪▒ ┌й█М ╪и┌╛█М ╪░┘Е█Б ╪п╪з╪▒█М █Б█Т ┌й█Б ┘И█Б █Б┘Е╪з╪▒█Т ╪│╪з╪к┌╛ ╪з┘Ж╪╡╪з┘Б ┌й╪▒█Т█Ф ╪м╪и ╪к┌й ┘Е┘Д┌й ┌й█Т ╪з┘Ж╪п╪▒ ╪з┘Ж╪╡╪з┘Б ╪з┘И╪▒ █Б┘Е╪п╪▒╪п█М ┘Ж█Б█М┌║ █Б┘И┌п█М╪М ╪к╪и ╪к┌й ┘Е┘Д┌й ╪к╪▒┘В█М ┘Ж█Б█М┌║ ┌й╪▒ ╪│┌й╪к╪з █Б█Т█Ф ╪з╪│ ┘И┘В╪к ┘Е┘Д┌й ┘Е█М┌║ ╪н╪з┘Д╪з╪к ╪и█Б╪к ╪о╪▒╪з╪и █Б█М┌║╪М ╪з┘И╪▒ ┘Д┘И┌п ╪┤╪з█Б█М┘Ж ╪и╪з╪║ ┘Е█М┌║╪М ╪м╪з┘Е╪╣█Б ┘Е┘Д█М█Б ╪з╪│┘Д╪з┘Е█М█Б ┘Е█М┌║╪М ╪╣┘Д█М ┌п┌С┌╛ █М┘И┘Ж█М┘И╪▒╪│┘╣█М ╪з┘И╪▒ ╪м█Т█Ф╪з█М┘Ж█Ф█М┘И█Ф ┘Е█М┌║ ╪п┌╛╪▒┘Ж█Т ┘╛╪▒ ╪и█М┘╣┌╛█Т █Б█М┌║╪М ┘И█Б╪з┌║ ┘╛╪▒ ┘╛╪▒┘И┘╣█М╪│┘╣ ┌й╪▒ ╪▒█Б█Т █Б█М┌║╪М ┘Е█М┌║ ╪│█М█Ф╪з█Т█Ф╪з█Т█Ф╪М ╪з█М┘Ж█Ф╪з┘У╪▒█Ф╪│█М█Ф ╪з┘И╪▒ ╪з█М┘Ж█Ф┘╛█М█Ф╪з┘У╪▒█Ф ┌й█М ┘Е╪о╪з┘Д┘Б╪к ┌й╪▒╪к╪з █Б┘И┌║█Ф ╪з╪│ ╪и╪з╪к ┌й█М ┘Е╪з┘Ж┌п ╪и┌╛█М ┌й╪▒╪к╪з █Б┘И┌║ ┌й█Б ╪│╪▒┌й╪з╪▒ ╪з╪│█Т ┘И╪з┘╛╪│ ┘Д█Т█Ф █Б┘Е╪з╪▒█Т ┘Е╪з┌║ ╪и█Б┘Ж█М┌║╪М ╪и█М┘╣█М╪з┌║╪М ╪и┌Ж█М╪з┌║ ╪з┘И╪▒ ╪и┘И┌С┌╛█М ╪╣┘И╪▒╪к█М┌║╪М ╪и┘И┌С┌╛█Т ┘Д┘И┌п ╪п┌╛╪▒┘Ж█Т ┘╛╪▒ ╪и█М┘╣┌╛█Т █Б█М┌║█Ф ┘Е█М┌║ ┘Ж█Т █М█Б ┌й█Б╪з ┌й█Б ╪з╪│ ╪│┘Д╪│┘Д█Т ┘Е█М┌║ ┌й┘И╪ж█М ╪и╪з╪к ┘Ж█Б█М┌║ ┌й█М ┌п╪ж█М █Б█Т█Ф ╪з┘У┘╛ ┘Ж█Т ┘Е█М╪▒╪з ╪│╪з╪▒╪з ┘И┘В╪к ╪к┘И ┘Д█Т █Б█М ┘Д█М╪з █Б█Т█Ф ┘Е█М╪▒█М ╪и╪▒╪и╪з╪п█М┘И┌║ ┘╛╪▒ ┘Ж█Б ┘Е╪│┌й╪▒╪з┘И┘П┌║ ┌Ж┘Е┘Ж ┘И╪з┘Д┘И┌║ ┌п┘П╪▓╪▒┘Ж█М ╪з█М┌й ╪п┘Ж ╪│╪▒ ╪│█Т ╪к┘Е█Б╪з╪▒█Т ╪и┌╛█М ┘В█М╪з┘Е╪к █Б█Т ╪з┘У┘╛ █М█Б ╪│╪м┌╛ ┘Д█М╪м█М╪ж█Т╪М ╪з╪│ ┘Д╪ж█Т ╪▓█М╪з╪п█Б ╪╕┘Д┘Е ┌й╪▒┘Ж╪з ╪з┌Ж┌╛╪з ┘Ж█Б█М┌║ █Б┘И╪к╪з █Б█Т█Ф █Б┘Ж╪п┘И╪│╪к╪з┘Ж ┌й█Т ╪з┘Ж╪п╪▒ ╪и┌╛╪з╪ж█М ┌Ж╪з╪▒█Б ┘╛█М╪п╪з ┌й█М╪м█М╪ж█Т█Ф ╪з╪к╪н╪з╪п ┘╛█М╪п╪з ┌й█М╪м█М╪ж█Т█Ф ╪з┌п╪▒ ┘Е┘Д┌й ┌й┘И ┘Ж█М╪з ╪п█М╪┤ ╪и┘Ж╪з┘Ж╪з █Б█Т╪М ╪з┌Ж┌╛╪з ┘Е┘Д┌й ╪и┘Ж╪з┘Ж╪з █Б█Т╪М ╪к╪▒┘В█М █М╪з┘Б╪к█Б ┘Е┘Д┌й ╪и┘Ж╪з┘Ж╪з █Б█Т ╪к┘И █Б┘Е█М┌║ ╪з█М┌й ╪п┘И╪│╪▒█Т ╪│█Т ┘Е╪н╪и╪к ┌й╪▒┘Ж█М █Б┘И┌п█М█Ф █Б┘Е█М┌║ ╪з█М┌й ╪п┘И╪│╪▒█Т ┌й█М ╪╣╪▓┘С╪к ┌й╪▒┘Ж█М █Б┘И┌п█М█Ф █Б┘Е╪з╪▒╪з ┘Е┘Д┌й ╪к╪и █Б█М ╪з┘У┌п█Т ╪и┌С┌╛ ╪│┌й╪к╪з █Б█Т█Ф ╪з┘У╪о╪▒ ┘Е█М┌║ ┘Е█М┌║ ╪з█М┌й ╪┤╪╣╪▒ ┘╛┌С┌╛ ┌й╪▒ ╪з┘╛┘Ж█М ╪и╪з╪к ╪о╪к┘Е ┌й╪▒╪к╪з █Б┘И┌║█Ф█Ф ╪з╪и┌╛█М ┌й█М╪з █Б█Т ┌й┘Д ╪з█М┌й█Ф╪з█М┌й ╪и┘И┘Ж╪п ┌й┘И ╪к╪▒╪│█Т ┌п╪з ┘Е█Б ╪о╪з┘Ж█Б ╪м┘И ╪з█Б┘Д┘Р ╪╢╪▒┘Б ┌й█Т █Б╪з╪к┌╛┘И┌║ ┘Е█М┌║ ┘╛█М┘Е╪з┘Ж█Т ┘Ж█Б█М┌║ ╪з┘У╪ж█Т █Б╪▒ ┘Е┘Д┌й ┌й█Т ╪з┘Ж╪п╪▒ ┘╛╪з╪▒┘╣█М╪з┌║ ╪и╪п┘Д╪к█М ╪▒█Б╪к█М █Б█М┌║█Ф ╪н┌й┘И┘Е╪к ╪и╪п┘Д╪к█М ╪▒█Б╪к█М █Б█Т█Ф █М█Б╪з┌║ ┘╛╪▒ ╪и┌╛█М ╪з█М┌й ╪п┘Ж ╪н┌й┘И┘Е╪к ╪и╪п┘Д ╪м╪з╪ж█Т ┌п█М█Ф ╪╡╪п╪▒┘Р ╪м┘Е█Б┘И╪▒█М█Б ┘Ж█Т █М█Б╪з┌║ ┘╛╪▒ ╪м┘И ╪о╪╖╪и█Б ┘╛┌С┌╛╪з ╪з┘И╪▒ ╪м┘И ┘╛╪з┘Д█М╪│█М ┘╛█М╪┤ ┌й█М █Б█Т╪з╪│ ┘╛╪з┘Д█М╪│█М ╪│█Т ┘Е╪м┌╛█Т ╪з╪к┘Б╪з┘В ┘Ж█Б█М┌║ █Б█Т█Ф █М█Б╪з┌║ ┘╛╪▒ ╪╣┘И╪з┘Е ┌й█Т ┘Д╪ж█Т ╪и┘Р┘Д ┘Ж█Б█М┌║ ┘Д╪з█М╪з ┌п█М╪з █Б█Т█Ф ╪╣┘И╪з┘Е ┌й█Т ┘Д╪ж█Т ╪║╪▒█М╪и┘И┌║ ┌й█Т ┘Д╪ж█Т╪М ┌й╪│╪з┘Ж┘И┌║ ┌й█Т ┘Д╪ж█Т ╪з╪│ ┘Е█М┌║ ┌й┌Ж┌╛ ┘Ж█Б█М┌║ █Б█Т█Ф ╪з╪│ ┘Е┘Д┌й ┘Е█М┌║ ┘Е█Б┘Ж┌п╪з╪ж█М ╪и┌С┌╛ column2: Please address the Chair. No cross talk. Please address the Chair. PROF. SOUGATA RAY: Sir, my amendments also relate to the highest unemployment rate in 45 years of which there has been no mention in the Address. They raised the matter of disinvestment of BPCL, LIC and 28 other PSUs to be disinvested. The whole Address does not mention the crisis in the auto industry, real estate sector, and the non-banking financial companies. So, this is an empty Address, which does not address any of the pressing problems of the country. Sir, before I proceed further, I strongly protest the way Mahatma GandhiтАЩs name has been used by these people in wrongly quoting him. In para 36, they have referred to Mahatma GandhiтАЩs statement as if on Mahatma GandhiтАЩs advice they are bringing the Citizenship Amendment Act. Please listen to what Mahatma Gandhi said. It is from The Collected Works of Mahatma Gandhi Vol. 96. Mahatma Gandhi said: тАЬIf we regard all the Muslims as fifth-columnists, will not the Hindus and Sikhs in Pakistan also be considered fifth-columnists? That would not do.тАЭ He was referring to Hindus and Sikhs in Pakistan. тАЬThe Hindus and the Sikhs staying there can come here by all means if they do not wish to continue staying there. In that case, it is the first duty of the Indian Government to give them jobs and make their lives comfortable. But they cannot continue to stay there and become petty spies and work for us and not for Pakistan.тАЭ This is what Gandhi ji said. He said that they should not stay there as our spies. If they stay there, they should be part of them. In the same writing, he said about the Muslims, тАЬThe Muslims have said they would be loyal to India. Let us trust them with our heart. Let us remember that truth alone triumphs; not untruth. рд╕рддреНрдпрдореЗрд╡ рдЬрдпрддреЗ , рдирд╛рдиреГрддрдореН редтАЭ This Government is going on untruth, not according to what Gandhi ji said. So, I demand that Gandhi jiтАЩs name should be deleted from para 36. They should not use the name ofPujya Bapuin pursuing their nefarious, divisive political designs. I want to mention that the country is in the biggest economic crisis in many years. You would understand that Reserve Bank of India was made to change its forecast four times on the domestic growth rate. First, it was 7.4 per cent; then they made it 6.14 per cent in November; in December, they made it 5 per cent. The International Monetary Fund slashed IndiaтАЩs 2019 growth rate forecast to 4.8 per cent from 6.1 per cent projected in October last. Both the United Nations and the World Bank have cut IndiaтАЩs growth rate forecast for the year 2020 to 5.7 and 5.0 per cent respectively. It is a dire state of affairs. Five per cent growth rate is lowest in 14 years; industrial growth rate is lowest in 14 years; demand for electricity consumption is lowest in last 12 years; private investment is lowest in last 16 years; unemployment index is alarmingly high in the last 45 years. Where will the unemployed get their jobs? Government says, тАЬGo and riot.тАЭ That is how unemployment will go. In Davos, in World Economic Forum this year, Oxfam report says that India's richest one per cent hold more than four-times the wealth held by 953 million people who make up for the bottom 70 per cent of the country's population, while the total wealth of all Indian billionaires is more than the full-year budget in our country. Just imagine, 63 billionaires are holding all the assets. <u> We will check the record. тАж (Interruptions) THE MINISTER OF STATE IN THE MINISTRY OF PARLIAMENTARY AFFAIRS AND MINISTER OF STATE IN THE MINISTRY OF HEAVY INDUSTRIES AND PUBLIC ENTERPRISES (SHRI ARJUN RAM MEGHWAL): The wordsтАж *are not good. тАж(Interruptions) PROF. SOUGATA RAY: Ever since the Citizenship (Amendment) Act was passed by the Parliament on 11thDecember 2019, there has been spontaneous protests all over the country starting with Tripura, Meghalaya and Assam. In Assam, three people were killed in police firing. Firing by the police has spread all over the country. In UP, the biggest State of the country, more than 20 people have been killed in police firing. The students of Jamia Millia Islamia were lathi charged by the police in the campus itself. The protest has spread from Jamia to AMU, BHU and Delhi University. Universities and colleges, even IITs across the country, have joined the protest. The controversial Citizenship (Amendment) Act has resulted in protests in several European cities and also by the Indian student community in US. Women have joined the protest in large number. I will tell you later, Shri Jaishankar, how we have been a failure. Women at Shaheen Bagh in Delhi have been ondharnain this cold open airfor the last one-and-a-half months. The GovernmentтАЩs anger is directed towards them. The Prime Minister makes them their target but they are braving the cold and sitting in protest against the GovernmentтАЩs divisive agenda. There have been firing and attacks on them by the BJP leader and pro-Hindu elements.тАж(Interruptions) Madam, you are not part of this. Shiromani Akali Dal is against NRC. I know it. You are with us. Why are you fighting with me? <u> You are having only one minute. Do not unnecessarily waste time. Please address the Chair. PROF. SOUGATA RAY: Sir, what didThe Economistsay? It said that largely fawning media in India have begun to speak out against Shri Narendra Modi, the Prime Minister, for his apparent determination to transform India from a tolerant and a multi-religious place into a chauvinist Hindu State. That is what you are doing. It further stated that massacre of Muslims in the State of Gujarat in 2002 when Mr. Modi was Chief Minister, made him a hero in the minds of Hindu nationalists (Hindu Hridaya Samrat) around the country. I am not saying this. This is being said byThe Economistmagazine тАж(Interruptions). <u> Please take your seat. Prof. Ray, you address the Chair. You wind up your speech. PROF. SOUGATA RAY: It further says that by undermining the secular principles of the Constitution, Mr. ModiтАЩs latest initiatives threaten to do damage to IndiaтАЩs democracy that could last for decades. They are also likely to lead to bloodshed. This Government has nothing to say except head bashing Pakistan. Mr. Adhir was right. He asked whether with Pakistan we would roar like a lion in front of China, it becomes a whimper. With such a divided India, will Foreign Direct Investment come to this country to remove our unemployment? Dr. Jaishankar, I will give you an example. There is a Company called KKR in the United States.TheFinancial Times, London, reported that KKR the biggest private equity firm in the world will not consider India for their core investment. You cannot have a divided India. Your own private investment is shrinking. One Ambani and one Adani will not be able to sustain this country. When Mr. Modi came to power again in 2019, we were in minority sitting on this side and looking at the great man how he would transform India. He had no new slogans. No Swachh Bharat. No Start-Ups. No Prime MinisterтАЩs Fasal Bhima Yojana. No Prime MinisterтАЩs Kisan Samman Nidhi. There was only тАШpersecutionтАЩ and тАШpolarisationтАЩ. рдореБрд╕рд▓рдорд╛рди рдХреЛ рдорд╛рд░реЛ , рджреЗрд╢ рдХрд╛ рднрд╛рдЧ рдХрд░ рджреЛ , рд╡рд┐рднрд╛рдЬрди рдХрд░ рджреЛ редтАж(рд╡реНрдпрд╡рдзрд╛рди) Lastly, I end my speech with this small quotation from a song from Hindi movie `1942 тАУ A Love StoryтАЩ. Our path to democracy is difficult. The girls in Shaheen Bagh are sitting there in this hope that the Government will scrap this. тАЬ рдпреЗ рд╕рдлрд░ рдмрд╣реБрдд рд╣реИ рдХрдард┐рди рдордЧрд░ рдирд╛ рдЙрджрд╛рд╕ рд╣реЛ рдореЗрд░реЗ рд╣рдорд╕рдлрд░ , рджрд┐рд▓ рдирд╛ рдЙрдореНрдореАрдж рддреЛ рдирд╣реАрдВ , рдирд╛рдХрд╛рдо рд╣реА рддреЛ рд╣реИ , рд▓рдореНрдмреА рд╣реИ рдЧрдо рдХреА рд╢рд╛рдо , рдордЧрд░ рд╢рд╛рдо рд╣реА рддреЛ рд╣реИ редтАЭ It is only the evening. Nothing will change. тАж(Interruptions). With this, I again oppose this. I really expected Mr. Modi to be here today. I spoke to the hon. Speaker. But he has no time to attend the Parliament. He only had Barack and he had Donald and all these people. We are just MPs тАж(Interruptions). Why should he come and waste his time listening to us? тАж(Interruptions) Minister Arjun Munda has also got up and left. тАж(Interruptions). In Bengal, Shri Dilip Ghosh spoke against us. тАж(Interruptions) <u> I already called Mr. JayadevтАЩs name. please conclude in one second. PROF. SOUGATA RAY: Shri Dilip Ghosh became MP and left his MLA seat. In the by-election held for that seat, BJP lost by 24000 votes. It proves that the BJP does not exist and will not flourish in West Bengal. тАж(Interruptions) With these words, I conclude. <u> Hon. Member, please take your seat. Mr. Jayadev, I am again telling you that any decision taken in the State Assembly cannot be mentioned here. It is the will of the State Assembly. We cannot interfere. Please be restricted to the Motion of Thanks on the PresidentтАЩs Address. Otherwise, I will call another hon. Member. тАж (Interruptions) <u> Kindly conclude please. PROF. ACHYUTANANDA SAMANTA : Sir, please give me another two minutes. They have told me that I will get 6-7 minutes. I reiterate the StateтАЩs demands for an increase in the rates of royalty that the State Government should get from the cess collected on coal by the Central Government. Similarly, Incredible India has a vast tourism potential. Odisha is also being explored as IndiaтАЩs best place. Some iconic sites of Odisha should be considered and taken up for tourism development. It can boost the socio-economic development of the region. Here, I would like to inform the hon. House that our hon. Chief Minister has taken all steps to give a new shape to heritage cities like Puri, Konark and Lingaraja Temple making Puri the cultural capital and Bhuvaneswar as the sports capital of India. Both the Tele-density and banking density have to be increased in Odisha. People have to climb trees and high-rise structures to get mobile networks. In this context, I would like to state that my Kandhamal district which is an aspirational district, is without any telephone facilities or mobile facilities and also the banking facilities are inadequate. Similarly, 112 districts have been declared as aspirational districts and many initiatives have been taken. However, things have to be geared up. I represent an aspirational district, Kandhamal, and I know the problems at the grassroots. Unless the initiatives from the Government and collaboration from the corporate world comes to these districts, it will never become inspiration from aspiration. Similarly, five trillion-dollar economy is doable. But emphasis has to be given on social sector spending like education and health. I believe that the level of education and literacy of the country determines the economy of the nation. For our youth to be turned to be a demographic dividend and not turn out to be a disaster, quality education and skill training are the only solutions. The major challenge is the employment generation. The allocations made have been inadequate. Focus should be on morehunar haathsand skill development. Lastly, Sir, we request for fiscal autonomy for the State. Our beloved Biju babu believed Odisha could transform into the most advanced State in South Asia with financial autonomy. Thank you very much. <u> No, your time is over. рд╕реБрд╢реНрд░реА рдкреНрд░рддрд┐рдорд╛ рднреМрдорд┐рдХ : рдЕрд░реБрдгрд╛рдЪрд▓ рдкреНрд░рджреЗрд╢ рдХреЗ рд▓реЛрдЧ рдХрднреА рд╕реЛрдЪрддреЗ рднреА рдирд╣реАрдВ рдереЗ рдХрд┐ рдпрд╣рд╛рдБ рдПрдпрд░рдкреЛрд░реНрдЯ рд╣реЛрдЧрд╛ ред рд╡рд░реНрд╖ 2022 рддрдХ рдЕрд░реБрдгрд╛рдЪрд▓ рдкреНрд░рджреЗрд╢ рдореЗрдВ рдПрдпрд░рдкреЛрд░реНрдЯ рдХрд╛ рдирд┐рд░реНрдорд╛рдг рд╣реЛ рдЬрд╛рдПрдЧрд╛ ред рдпрд╣ рдмрд╛рдд рднреА рдЙрд╕рдореЗрдВ рд╣реИ ред рдиреЙрд░реНрде - рдИрд╕реНрдЯ рдХреЛ рд░реЗрд╕реНрдЯ рдСрдл рдЗрдВрдбрд┐рдпрд╛ рд╕реЗ рдЕрд▓рдЧ рдХрд░рдХреЗ рд░рдЦрд╛ рдЧрдпрд╛ рд╣реИ ред рдиреЙрд░реНрде - рдИрд╕реНрдЯ рдХрд╛ рднреМрдЧреЛрд▓рд┐рдХ рдХреНрд╖реЗрддреНрд░рдлрд▓ рдпреВрдкреА рдЬреИрд╕рд╛ рд╣реИ , рдЬреЛ рдЗрдВрдбрд┐рдпрд╛ рдХреЗ рдХреНрд╖реЗрддреНрд░рдлрд▓ рдХрд╛ 9 рдкрд░рд╕реЗрдВрдЯ рд╣реИ ред рдпрд╣рд╛рдБ рдХреА рдЬрдирд╕рдВрдЦреНрдпрд╛ рдорд╛рддреНрд░ рдкрд╛рдБрдЪ рдХрд░реЛреЬ рд╣реИ ред рдЗрд╕рд▓рд┐рдП рд╡рд╣рд╛рдБ рдкрд░ рдмрд╣реБрдд - рд╕реА рд╕рдВрднрд╛рд╡рдирд╛рдПрдБ рд╣реИрдВ ред рдЙрди рд╕рдВрднрд╛рд╡рдирд╛рдУрдВ рдХреЛ рджреЗрдЦрддреЗ рд╣реБрдП рдкреНрд░рдзрд╛рди рдордВрддреНрд░реА рдЬреА рдиреЗ рдЙрддреНрддрд░ - рдкреВрд░реНрд╡рд╛рдВрдЪрд▓ рдХреЗ рд▓рд┐рдП рдиреНрдпреВ рдЗрдВрдбрд┐рдпрд╛ рдХреА рддрд░рд╣ рдХрд╛рдо рдХрд░рдиреЗ рдХреА рдкреНрд░рддрд┐рдмрджреНрдзрддрд╛ рдЬрддрд╛рдИ рд╣реИ ред рд╕рд┐рдХреНрдХрд┐рдо рд╕рд╣рд┐рдд рдкреВрд░реЗ рдЙрддреНрддрд░ - Sir, thank you for giving me this opportunity to speak on the Motion of Thanks on the PresidentтАЩs Address. Let me start by saying that this is the eighth consecutive Budget that the people of Andhra Pradesh have had to face disappointment. AP has been in a crisis mode for more than ten years. Even before the bifurcation with all the Telangana agitation etc. for more than 10 years, our State has been in crisis mode. We are not in a position to envision our future due to the continuing uncertainties. We are constrained to focus on our State issues and do not even have the luxury to participate in the dialogue about the nation as a whole when our State is suffering and on the brink of economic collapse. On top of the challenges being faced due to unfair bifurcation, our State was victimized. We are also facing lack of promised support from the Centre in not fulfilling the provisions of the AP Reorganization Act in full. Further to that, due to the illogical and irrational decisions taken by the new Government, our State which was among the top performing States in the country with double digit GSDP growth and leading in industrial investments, in infrastructure development, is now on the brink of economic collapse. The fall in tax revenue collection in the State is one of the highest in the country and over Rs. 1.8 lakh crores worth of investments have been withdrawn from the State. The decision to scrap PPAs has brought the reputation of the State and the country as an investment destination into question with countries threatening legal action. Among the many challenges we are facing the most burning issue is the decision of the AP Government to split the capital into three pieces, moving the executive capital to Vishakhapatnam, the legislative capital to Amravati and the judicial capital to Kurnool тАж(Interruptions). What is this? I seek your intervention. I seek your protection. тАж(Interruptions) <u> Among the many challenges we are facing, the most burning issue is the decision of the AP Government to split the capital into three pieces. Just imagine a situation that the Central Government decided to move the Parliament to Hyderabad and move the Supreme Court to Trivandrum and also decided to abolish Rajya Sabha in order to get it passed. This is the situation being faced by the people of Andhra Pradesh now. We have the Rajasthan Legislative Council Bill, 2013 which was sent to the Steering Committee. One of the suggestions that the Committee took into consideration is: тАЬThere is a need to evolve a national policy consensus with regard to creation/abolition of Legislative Council particularly in regard to the fact that the status of the second chamber cannot be temporary in nature depending on the mood of the Government of the day nor can be abolished once created, only at the whims and fancies of a newly elected Government in the State.тАЭ This Bill came up in 2013 and because of lack of a national consensus, Rajasthan is yet to have a Legislative Council. You can imagine the seriousness of the decision to abolish the Council. Coming back to Amaravati, I would like to thank the Minister of State for Home Affairs, Shri Nityanand Rai for his response to my Unstarred Question yesterday in which he stated that the Government of Andhra Pradesh had notified Amaravati as the capital of Andhra Pradesh through a GO on 23.4.2015 and it is for each State to decide its capital тАУ and not capitals тАУ within its own territory. This means that Amaravati has been decided as the capital of the State of Andhra Pradesh as a GO in this regard has been issued and has been recognized by the Centre. It is very clear by the hon. If we have three capitals, will the Central Government fund the development of infrastructure and connectivity to all the three capitals? So, if they are going to scrap the APCRDA Act, how can they compensate the farmers? тАж(Interruptions) Sir, there is also the question of democratic and human rights. There has been no sensitivity. <u> Sir, I would like to say just two things before concluding. The Capital model being planned by the current Andhra Pradesh Government is not only going to create a burden on the tax payers for generations, but the National Green Tribunal in its verdict on 20thNovember, 2017, while saying that Amaravati Capital Region does not fall under the flood prone area also said the large scale of the project has already been executed at huge public expense and any prohibitory direction at this stage would not only jeopardize the financial interest of the State, but would even become a serious environmental issue, capable of degrading the environment and ecology of the area to the disadvantage of the public interest as well.

It is an honour to get this opportunity to address this august House on such a significant occasion. I would like to bring to the notice of the House a few issues pertaining to my State as well as to the country. As my colleague Mr. Jayadev had raised several issues regarding Andhra Pradesh, I would like to answer a few of his arguments. Our hon. Prime Minister has come back to lead the country with a thumping majority which I believe and which most people believe was because of his right intention to take the country forward, his dedication and ability to take tough decisions. But I have to remind the House, the same thing did not happen in my State of Andhra Pradesh. I understand that the Ruling PartyтАЩs erstwhile partner from Andhra Pradesh, the Telugu Desam Party, broke up the alliance in 2013 on whimsical reasons thinking that NDA is not going to come back to power. (Interruptions)тАж * <u> All right, Sir,тАж*even boasted on live TV of being instrumental in defeating the BJP in Madhya Pradesh, Rajasthan and Chhattisgarh. I understand the bad taste they may have left in you by all the backstabbing they attempted. As a consequence, I am afraid Andhra Pradesh is still facing the brunt of their unstable, unreliable and conniving behaviour from the past. I am surprised howтАж*is making his three MPs cosy up to the Ruling Party and dumping his current partners who happen to fall in the Opposition. The TDP has not only betrayed the House but also the State as well as the people of Andhra Pradesh in a similar fashion. * They took our debt from Rs.70,000 crore to a whopping Rs.2.5 lakh crore in five years. They left almost Rs.60,000 crore unpaid bills. They spent Rs.30,000 crore on the last day before election trying to fool people in the name of freebies. In the name of world-class capital, they planned to centralize development in one particular pocket serving themselves with a plan to amass personal wealth. They acquired 4,000 acres of land, announced that, that was the region where the capital was going to be built and declared all the surrounding areas as green belt. Then, their masterplan was to make more than Rs.1 lake crore from the 4,000 acres of land they acquired with insider information. Our people did not buy into this deceit. I have to remind the NDA that the old guard was thrown out. A new Government was formed under the YSRCP which I am proudly representing, led by a young dynamic Chief Minister, Shri Jagan Mohan Reddy Garu who won 151 out of 175 MLA seats and 22 out of 25 MP seats. I also have to bring it to your attention that YSRCP has unconditionally travelled with the Treasury Benches since the last few months. We have voted with you for the Triple Talaq Bill; we have voted with you to remove Article 370; and we have voted with you on CAA. We justified these controversial Bills back home all by ourselves. But the general feeling within our State about Delhi is not very positive at the moment. We still feel neglected and ignored as a State. I have to bring to your attention as to how passionately my Chief Minister is implementing poverty alleviation programmes, taking governance to the doorsteps by employing lakhs of volunteers and village level Secretariat employees. He is also working on decentralizing development by focussing on backward areas--let it be Rayalaseema or North Coastal Andhra Pradesh-- unlike the earlier Government which wanted to put all their eggs in their basket. This is my personal favourite idea which I think the whole country needs to implement. He made a law to bring 50 per cent reservation in nominated posts for BCs, SCs, STs, minorities and women. тАж(Interruptions) Sir, I have more than 10 minutes time. For the first time since Independence, there is a BC District Cooperative Bank Chairman in my district. For the first time there is a Muslim Agriculture Market Committee Chairman in my area. For the first time, there is going to be a woman who is going to be the Chairman of a famous Hanuman temple in my parliamentary constituency. The so-called underprivileged classes are finally getting the much needed social upliftment within our communities or within our villages. I understand we had reservation for the past 70 years but that benefitted people who wanted to get educated, get jobs and leave the villages but currently, for the first time, within our communities, we see the real social upliftment which was much needed for the last 70 years. The YSRCP is effectively making dreams come true of Dr. Baba Saheb Ambedkar and Mahatma Gandhi Ji. I now demand more attention to our State. I now demand justice to our State. I now demand that all outstanding dues, which are owed to our State, be cleared. You all must be aware of how unfairly our State has been treated in this very House. I request the Government under the leadership of our hon. Prime Minister, Narendra Modi Ji, to make up for all the shortcomings our State has faced under the previous Government. Sir, in addition to these, I am excited about the 5 trillion Dollar economy, we are talking about. I am also excited about the doubling of farmers income. My segment is 90 per cent farming dependent and I would like more clarity on the path to achieving the double income. I have not seen any action plan on achieving this target. Irrigation projects could help us in the long run. I would like the Central Government to assist our Government to complete some our lifeline irrigation projects besides timely funding of Polavaram as promised. Efforts to identify and create demand for agriculture produce should be a priority. Five years ago, a tonne of eucalyptus was about Rs.5000. For past few years, it has been still struggling at around Rs.2000. Farmers, who have grown eucalyptus for last three years, are in deep distress, unable to get enough money even for harvesting. The price of paper is down because people are shifting from paper to plastic, which is a lot cheaper, in spite of all the pollution around it. The Government has to step in and regulate to control pollution on one side and to replace it with products made with agriculture produce. As an example, I suggest a complete ban on plastic plates, plastic glasses and plastic table rolls, which have no safe way to be disposed of. The ban will create a demand for agriculture produce pushing up prices for farmers. There was an earlier proposal for a National Oil Mission to increase oil seed production within the country to reduce imports. But I see no mention of it in the PresidentтАЩs Address or the Budget. Andhra Pradesh needs it and is ready to deploy it on infrastructure. Upgradation of the 500 kms Buckingham Canal, the freight Canal from Pondicherry to Kakinada is long overdue after the foundation stone has been laid by our hon. Road Transport and Highways Minister, Shri Nitin Gadkari. A new railway line of just 70 kms from Kovvur to Bhadrachalam, which passes through backward regions including regions of SC/ST population is long overdue. ....(Interruptions). <u> It reduces travel time by two hours from Visakhapatnam to Hyderabad, Bhubaneswar to Bangalore, Bhubaneswar to Mumbai saving a lot of money for the railways. ....(Interruptions) Finally, I hope going forward the Government can give the much needed helping hand to Andhra Pradesh to achieve our common goals of equitable distribution of wealth and social justice. I gladly support the Motion of Thanks. (PROF.) KIRIT PREMJIBHAI SOLANKI (AHMEDABAD WEST) : It gives me immense pleasure to express my views on the Motion of Thanks to the President Address. Within just about 8-9 months from being elected our government under the leadership of Prime Minister Modi has accomplished many tasks that were pending since independence. Our Government repealed Article 370 and Article 35A of the Constitution, relating to the special status for Jammu and Kashmir; The Citizenship Amendment Act, 2019 was passed by Parliament to grant citizenship to persecuted minorities from neighbouring countries; Appointed the Chief of Defence Staff and created the Department of Military Affairs; Reduced corporate tax and the codified labour laws to improve the ease of doing business; Extended the Reservation for SC/STтАЩs in state legislatures and Parliament for a period of 10 years. The Government is committed to develop Kashmir from a backward state to a developed one through adequate investments and social welfare schemes. The state which was known for terrorism will be in future known for its strong infrastructure, flourishing tourism industry, skilled manpower and peace. Jammu and Kashmir is one of the few states which have IITs, IIMs and two AIIMS hospitals. Two ensure connectivity to the UT of Ladakh even during winter, several highways and underpass roads are being constructed at a rapid pace. In spite of the difficulty due to rough geography and weather conditions 100% electrification has been achieved due to the constant efforts of our government. After the removal of special status, the people will enjoy benefits from all India schemes like Pradhan Mantri Awas Yojana, Swachh Bharat Abhiyan, Ujjwala, Ayushman Yojana and Ujala Yojana. I also thank the President for mentioning the landmark CAA which was passed in august house after detailed discussion. The Act provides rights to minorities from our neighbouring countries who have been persecuted due to religious discrimination. Members from Dalit community who live in large numbers will benefit from this move as they had faced religious discrimination in countries like Pakistan. As mentioned by our HonтАЩble Home Minister Amit Shah (BJP rally Hubli, Karnataka) and party president J.P. Nadda (multiple occasions), those against CAA are not thinking about the condition of Dalits who live in Pakistan. They are forced to convert to Islam or Christainity because of this and the opposition must think about it before opposing this move. In fact about 70-80% of refugees from these neighbouring countries are dalits and it is the duty of our Government to protect them (by JP Nadda, President BJP). By being Anti-CAA, opposition is being anti-Dalit. They are preventing Dalits from enjoying the benefits which have been given by the Indian Constitution as per the wishes of Dr. Ambedkar ji. The PresidentтАЩs speech also highlighted the government commitment towards poor communities like Schedule Caste and Scheduled Tribes. Under leadership of PM Modi, Dr. AmbedkarтАЩs dream of achieving social equality is becoming a reality as the government is working hard to ensure that the benefits of schemes reach the SC/STs. To improve the nutritional status of Women and children from SC/ST, preference has been given in schemes like Mission Indradhanush (vaccination of pregnant women) and under the Pradhan Mantri Matru Vandana Yojana (Maternity benefit scheme). Senior officers have been given the task of ensuring that the benefits of schemes reach all the poor people. Secondly, for the benefit of Tribal community government has extended the benefit of MSP to forest produce. To improve the educational status of Tribals 400 Eklavya Model Residential Schools are planned to be opened in the country. The Government has increased allocation for this by 98%. Sir, apart from social justice, the Government has also dedicated itself in providing both quality and affordable healthcare. More than 6,000 Jan Aushadhi Kendras have been set up to provide affordable healthcare. Capping of prices of more than 1000 essential medicines has resulted in a saving of Rs.12,500 crore for the patients. Reduced cost of stents and knee-implants has provided huge relief to lakhs of patients. The National Medical Commission set up after taking over the Medical Council of India has increased the speed and efficiency in setting up of healthcare facilities in the country. As mentioned by the President 75 new medical colleges have been sanctioned this year, which will result in an increase in MBBS seats by about 16 thousand and PG seats by more than 4 thousand. Finally, I would like to appreciate the government for all the initiatives it has taken for improvement of water management. Formation of an integrated new Ministry called the Jal Shakti Ministry is a welcome step. To mitigate the effects of drought due to climate, crore has been made for the same change, schemes like Jal Jeevan Mission has been launched to provide piped water. An allocation of Rs. 7750 has been made for the same. The Jal Shakti Abhiyan which has been announced to encourage rainwater harvesting is also a welcome step and I hope that Gujarat will have a lionтАЩs share of the 100 districts which will be selected in this mission.

Sir, I wish to thank you for giving me this opportunity to speak on the Motion of Thanks on the Address given by hon. President. Before I speak on the Motion, I wish to express my sincere gratitude to my late mercurial leader, Puratchi Thalaivi AMMA. We are the most fortunate to have Narendra Modi Ji as our guiding spirit to lay a strong foundation in the last five years, to make this decade India's decade, and this century India's century. He has set new standards in building the nation. Due to Government's strong commitment, several historic legislations have been enacted. In a democracy, nothing is more sacred than the mandate given by the people. The people of the country have given this mandate to Government for the making of a new India, a new India in which adequate facilities and newopportunities for growth are available for the poor, Dalits, women, youth, tribals and minorities, a new India, where every region develops, no region is left behind, and where the benefits of modern technology reach the farthest end of society. I wish to thank the hon. President for including the vision and mission of this Government and its achievements in the last five years to provide a perfect platform for our country to become the world leader in the 21stcentury. Our Prime MinisterтАЩs success mantra is `Sabka Saath, Sabka Vikas, Sabka VishwasтАЩ. He is working with full commitment and sincerity. Providing free gas connections to eight crore rural poor women, houses to two crore rural and urban poor, bank accounts to about 38 crore poor, free treatment facility of up to Rs. 5 lakh to 50 crore people, and free electricity connections to over 2.5 crore is a herculean task achieved through our Prime MinisterтАЩs sheer commitment and will power. The abrogation of Article 370 and Article 35A of the Constitution by two-thirds majority in both the Houses of Parliament is not only historic, but has also paved the way for equitable development of Jammu and Kashmir and Ladakh. For this, I wish to thank the hon. Prime Minister and also hon. Home Minister. In order to ensure the availability of sufficient quantity of potable drinking water to each rural household in the country, the Government has launched the Jal Jeevan Mission. In the coming days, Rs. 3,60,000 crore will be spent on this scheme. This will be one of the greatest achievements of independent India. The Government has launched the Atal Bhujal Yojana with special focus on seven of the most vulnerable States of the country, where ground water level is depleting rapidly. In this regard, I wish the Government to take care of the people of Tamil Nadu and get them their per capita share of water for both drinking and irrigation. On the special request of the Union Government, an unprecedented increase in Haj quota was made by Saudi Arabia as a result of which a record two lakh Indian Muslims performed the sacred Haj yatra. India is the first country where the entire process of Haj pilgrimage has been made digital and online. The Government is also undertaking 100 per cent digitization of Waqf properties across the country, so that these properties can be utilized for the welfare of the Muslim community. I thank the hon. President for highlighting this achievement of the Government. Under the Prime Minister Kisan Samman Nidhi, more than Rs. 43,000 crore have been deposited in the bank accounts of more than eight crore farmer families. In January this year, the Government has created a record by transferring Rs. 12,000 crore to the bank accounts of six crore farmers simultaneously. тАж(Interruptions). The Government of Tamil Nadu has also initiated such financial assistance to the farmers of the State and have been successfully implementing the schemes of the Union Government to prove that Tamil Nadu is second to none when it comes to follow and implement the developmental and welfare schemes of farmers. тАж(Interruptions). <u> I am just concluding. I am very proud to say that my state of Tamil Nadu has been chosen for the Central Government Krishi Karman Award. It may be noted that during the past eight years, under the AIADMK regime, this award has been bagged five times for which the Agriculture Department of our Union Government has congratulated the State Government under the leadership of our Chief Minister and our Deputy Chief Minister of Tamil Nadu. Through you, I wish to thank the hon. President and hon. Prime Minister Shri Narendra Modi for giving this wonderful platform to us to come together to create a New India. Let us together make a New India and make India the world super power. With these words, I conclude. * * ADV. DEAN KURIAKOSE (IDUKKI) : Constitution of India provides under Article 87 for address of HonтАЩble President of India to Joint Session of Parliament at the commencement of first session in each year essentially to highlight GovernmentтАЩs policy priorities and developmental plan for the upcoming year. But unfortunately the Address given by HonтАЩble President in this Session lacks this very essential feature of constitutionally envisaged PresidentтАЩs Address. Apart from some bogus claims and vague promises, as this Government and particularly Prime Minister would make in every public gatherings, there is no concrete vision introduced in this Address. Neither any definite policy priorities nor any development agenda is put forth in this Address. In effect, I am very sorry to say that, this PresidentтАЩs Address is seen to be a cloning of speech of Prime Minister as he would make every other day on streets. This Address lacks the minimum decorum and substance essential for PresidentтАЩs Address to the Parliament. This Government is evading from explaining the actual situation in the country at present to the Parliament and PresidentтАЩs Address fails to deal with this situation and has failed to explain how this Government is going to address the real issues of this period. Economists of national and international reputation repeatedly giving warnings about the economic stringency we are facing now. Well known political observers are anxious of the political situation of the country. Intellectuals from all walks are pointing out that the current social and political situation in India is not suitable for a civilized nation with seven decades of democratic history. The policies of this Government one after the other are destroying the social fabric and economic stability of this country. This Government has already broken backbone of our economy by absurd demonetization and badly implemented GST. People of this country are living in a constant fear and anxiety. BJP has brought all constitutional institutions and media offices under their clutches and control. They are making all efforts to silence scholars and intellectuals by hook or crook. There has never been such a disastrous situation, where people from all walks of life are suffering socially and economically, in the history of independent India. Indian society, which is always secular at its roots, is now being polarized on cast and religious basis. Government of the country itself is dividing its people with hate mongering and divisive policies. Despite all these realities glaring at our face, the President Address keeps absolute silence on all these issues as it is drafted by somebody from some alien planet, who does not know anything about the present situation of this country. This Government has already made most of the state Raj Bhavans as franchises of party headquarter of BJP by filling up the post of governors with their political volunteers. Most of the governors appointed by this government are acting in complete disregard to the constitutional moralities and well established democratic principles. Some of them are even interfering with day to day political affairs of their respective state and making public statement and addressing media persons every day without any decorum and respect to the position they are holding. For instance, the Governor of Kerala is behaving ditto like party leader of BJP. Now, it is evident from this address of President that this government has made this office also yet another mouth piece of their political outfit.
